title: go spec: scope for short variable declarations is undefined
body:
Under "Declarations and scope", the spec says:

"The scope of a constant or variable identifier declared inside a function begins
at the end of the ConstSpec or VarSpec and ends at the end of the innermost containing
block."

Short variable declarations do not have a VarSpec, so it's not clear what the scope is
for variables declared using short variable declarations.
